head.title: ING SALE OF DE BROE EXPECTED

identified-content.classifier: Top/Classifieds/Job Market/Job Categories/Banking, Finance and Insurance

hedline.hl1: ING SALE OF DE BROE EXPECTED

abstract.p: ING Groep of Netherlands is expected to sell its stock brokerage firm, Williams de Broe, to eliminate overlap that would result from ING's 127 million pound ($190.5 million) purchase of Charterhouse Securities; Williams de Broe's senior managers have right to buy ING's nearly 80 percent stake, held by Banque Bruxelles de Lambert, a subsidiary (S)

block.p: The Dutch financial company ING Groep is expected to sell its stock brokerage firm Williams de Broe to eliminate overlap that would result from ING's 127 million pounds ($190.5 million) purchase of Charterhouse Securities. Williams de Broe's senior managers have the right to buy ING's nearly 80 percent stake, held by Banque Bruxelles de Lambert, a subsidiary. Outside parties that may be interested include KBC Bancassurance, a Belgian banking and insurance company, and BNP Paribas, a French bank. A price for Williams de Broe has not been discussed.

Williams de Broe's senior managers have the right to buy ING's nearly 80 percent stake, held by Banque Bruxelles de Lambert, a subsidiary. Outside parties that may be interested include KBC Bancassurance, a Belgian banking and insurance company, and BNP Paribas, a French bank. A price for Williams de Broe has not been discussed.
